title: Little Sonny Jones - New Orleans Rhythm and Blues 1975
description:
Little Sonny Jones (April 15, 1931 - December 17, 1989) was an American New Orleans blues singer and songwriter. He was born Johnny Jones in New Orleans, Louisiana, United States, and started singing professionally in the late 1940s. He befriended Fats Domino and, whilst working together, was given his nickname by Domino. 

Jones was employed as the vocalist by a New Orleans based band led by the brothers, David and Melvin Lastie, until the late 1960s. Jones also had regular employment at a sugar factory. He returned to the recording studio in 1975, and issued his album, New Orleans R&B Gems, initially on the Netherlands based Black Magic label. With contributions from veteran musicians including Dave 'Fat Man' Williams, the record faithfully copied the R&B style and sound of the 1950s. (wikipedia.org)

- - -

Little Sonny Jones - New Orleans Rhythm and Blues 1975
(Black Magic 1995)

 1. I Would If I Could   
 2. I'm Loaded  
 3. Don't You Hear Me Calling You?  
 4. Certainly All  
 5. Do You Really Love Me, Baby? 
 6. She's My Desire  
 7. Further on up the Road   
 8. Worried Blues   
 9. Is Everything Allright?   
10. Here I Stand With My Heart in My Hand  
11. I Called You Baby
